ConfigNotes: Add AzureAd to User Secrets with actual values for Instance, ClientId, Domain, and TenantId

AzureAd.Comment: You need specify the TenantId only if you want to accept access tokens from a single tenant (line of business app) Otherwise you can leave them set to common
AzureAd.Comment2: for instance contoso.onmicrosoft.com. Not used in the ASP.NET core template
AzureAd.Comment3: The tenant's Directory ID (a guid) or 'common' or 'organizations' or 'consumers'
